pli-tv-pvr10:3.4: The end quote in the Pali seems to be a mistake.
pli-tv-pvr10:4.3: This number seems to be the sum of all the rules in both Monastic Codes, with the rules in common between the nuns and the monks only counted once. Also, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues are not counted.
pli-tv-pvr10:11.3: These are bhikkhu pārājika 1, 3, and 4.
pli-tv-pvr10:15.1: Bhikkhu pācittiya 81 and bhikkhu pāṭidesanīya 2.
pli-tv-pvr10:16.1: All rules not laid down in the six other towns were laid down in Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-pvr10:19.3: Bhikkhu saṅghādisesa 6, bhikkhu nissaggiya pācittiya 11, and bhikkhu pācittiya 5.
pli-tv-pvr10:22.1: Bhikkhu pācittiya 86 and bhikkhu pāṭidesanīya 4.
pli-tv-pvr10:28.2: Reading vipattiyo with the PTS edition in place of vibhattiyo.
pli-tv-pvr10:33.4: See bhikkhu saṅghādisesas 10-13 and bhikkhunī saṅghādisesas 10-13.
pli-tv-pvr10:33.5: See bhikkhu pācittiya 68 and bhikkhunī pācittiya 36.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.1: See bhikkhu pācittiyas 87, 89-92, and bhikkhunī pācittiya 22.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.5: See bhikkhu nissaggiya pācittiyas 2, 14, and 29, and bhikkhu pācittiya 9.
pli-tv-pvr10:36.6: See bhikkhu nissaggiya pācittiyas 10 and 22; bhikkhu pācittiyas 34, 71, and 84; and the concluding section for each of the monks and the nuns saṅghādisesa offenses.
pli-tv-pvr10:37.1: See bhikkhu nissaggiya pācittiya 30; bhikkhu pācittiyas 16, 20, 29, 36, 62-66, 69, 70, and 82; bhikkhunī pārājika 6, bhikkhunī saṅhādisesa 2, and bhikkhunī pācittiya 51.
pli-tv-pvr10:38.1: Leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr10:38.4: Again, leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr10:40.3: Again, leaving out the seven principles for settling legal issues.
pli-tv-pvr10:66.5: SP.5.339: Catutthagāthāya accayo tena samo natthīti desanāgāminīsu accayesu tena samo thūlo accayo natthi, “In the fourth verse, ‘There is no offense like that,’ means that in regard to the offenses that are to be confessed, there is no gross offense that is equivalent to that.”
pli-tv-pvr10:72.3: I take aviditaṁ to be a contracted version of appaṭisaṁviditaṁ, see bhikkhu pāṭidesanīya 4.
